Class vz390

  • java.lang.Object
    • vz390

  • public class vz390
extends java.lang.Object
    This class services all VSAM requests. Majorly restructured at RPI 1614. It now supports the original zVSAM logic (version 1) as well as the revised and extended logic (version 2). (Informally called dual-version framework.) Original source class structure: 
      +-------------------------------------+
  | Class name: vz390                   |
  | - fields                            |
  | - methods                           |
  |                                     |
  +-------------------------------------+
    Source class structure after RPI 1614: Two inner classes have been defined. V1 contains all the methods from the original vz390. All the fields from the original vz390 remain in vz390. Class V2 contains all the methods required for the new logic, and any fields that are needed additional to the original fields. All the original fields in class vz390 are accessible to each of the inner classes. The two inner classes are totally independent of each other. 
      +-----------------------------------------+
  | Class name: vz390                       |
  | - original fields                       |
  | - constructor (new)                     |
  | - 1 original method (svc_vsam)          |
  |                                         |
  |                                         |
  |    +-------------------------------+    |
  |    | Class name: V1                |    |
  |    | - original methods            |    |
  |    | - method: handle_vsam_request |    |
  |    |                               |    |
  |    +-------------------------------+    |
  |                                         |
  |                                         |
  |    +-------------------------------+    |
  |    | Class name: V2                |    |
  |    | - new fields                  |    |
  |    | - new methods                 |    |
  |    | - method: handle_vsam_request |    |
  |    |                               |    |
  |    +-------------------------------+    |
  |                                         |
  +-----------------------------------------+
    This dual-version framework is intended to continue to support the original VSAM implementation during the (probably long) development of version 2. The way that this works is that a runtime parameter (zVSAM(n)) will specify which version is to run. Values of n can be 1 or 2 (default 1).

    A constructor for vz390 was introduced at RPI 1614. It chooses, dependent on the runtime parm, to create a V1 object or a V2 object, but not both. The one remaining original method (named svc_vsam) in vz390 will simply forward each VSAM Request to the method named handle_vsam_request in the created object.

    After initialisation, the following objects exist, dependent on version chosen: 

      +-------------------------------------------------+
  | Object name: vz390                              |
  | - method name: svc_vsam                         |
  |    +---------------------------------------+    |
  |    | Object name: the_VSAM_Handler         |    |
  |    | Object type: V1                       |    |
  |    | Implements : Generic_VSAM_Handler     |    |
  |    | - method name: handle_vsam_request    |    |
  |    +---------------------------------------+    |
  |                                                 |
  +-------------------------------------------------+  if parm ZVSAM(1) was specified (or defaulted)

                     -- OR --

  +-------------------------------------------------+
  | Object name: vz390                              |
  | - method name: svc_vsam                         |
  |    +---------------------------------------+    |
  |    | Object name: the_VSAM_Handler         |    |
  |    | Object type: V2                       |    |
  |    | Implements : Generic_VSAM_Handler     |    |
  |    | - method name: handle_vsam_request    |    |
  |    +---------------------------------------+    |
  |                                                 |
  +-------------------------------------------------+  if parm ZVSAM(2) was specified
    Even though the objects are of different types (V1 & V2), either one can be instantiated and addressed via the reference the_VSAM_Handler because both implement the interface Generic_VSAM_Handler. And implementing that interface guarantees that the JVM will be able to resolve the method name handle_vsam_request no matter which of the two classes has been instantiated.
